title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 17.2 - Dealer and transporter number plates continued
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 17.2 - Dealer and transporter number plates continued

State Regulations
(a) Dealer and transporter number plates
assigned for use on vehicles during the registration period commencing January
1, 1966, and dealer and transporter plates assigned for use on vehicles on
original applications in registration periods thereafter, shall consist of two
number plates and one validating sticker, except that only one motorcycle
dealer number plate and one validating sticker shall be issued to motorcycle
dealers for use on a motorcycle. The validity of such dealer and transporter
number plates shall expire December 31, 1973. (b) Dealer and transporter number plates
assigned for use on vehicles by dealers or transporters who are issued original
registrations for registration periods commencing on and after January 1, 1973, and for dealers or transporters who are issued renewal registrations for
registration periods commencing on and after January 1, 1974, shall consist of
one number plate and one validating sticker, except that only one motorcycle
dealer number plate and two validating stickers shall be issued to motorcycle
dealers for use on a motorcycle. Such dealer and transporter number plates
shall be reflectorized and such plates shall be continued for succeeding
registration periods, until otherwise prescribed by the commissioner, so long
as the dealer's or transporter's registration is renewed for each such
registration period. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
17.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
